message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the Global Terrorism Database and the World Development Indicators dataset, we investigate the relationship between terrorist attacks and economic development.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database", "World Development Indicators"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to examine the relationship between women's empowerment and child health outcomes in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from the Global Burden of Disease as well as climate data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to estimate the health impacts of heatwaves in different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease", "National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of trade on employment, we use a panel dataset on manufacturing firms covering several African countries and complement it with household survey data.", "dataset": ["panel dataset on manufacturing firms", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Using publicly available financial data and environmental datasets, this study investigates the relationship between corporate sustainability performance and financial performance of companies in emerging economies.", "dataset": ["publicly available financial data", "environmental datasets"], "topic": ["Environment", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a unique dataset on child nutrition and education outcomes in rural areas of India, and supplement it with geospatial data on water resources and infrastructure to explore the determinants of nutritional adequacy and educational achievement among children.", "dataset": ["unique dataset on child nutrition and education outcomes", "geospatial data on water resources and infrastructure"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education", "Infrastructure", "Water"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses satellite imagery data and census data to estimate the causal impact of electrification on household welfare and economic development in rural areas of sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "census data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data and spatial datasets on land use and forest cover, this study examines the factors driving deforestation and explores the potential for incentive-based mechanisms to reduce forest loss and improve livelihoods of local communities in Cameroon.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "spatial datasets on land use and forest cover"], "topic": ["Environment", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a new dataset on cross-country infrastructure connectivity and use it to analyze how transportation infrastructure affects trade flows and economic growth in different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["new dataset on cross-country infrastructure connectivity"], "topic": ["Transport", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes micro-level survey data on households and firms in Ghana and Kenya and complements it with macroeconomic datasets on credit markets and natural resource endowments to investigate the channels through which financial inclusion policies can promote economic growth and poverty reduction in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["micro-level survey data on households and firms in Ghana and Kenya", "macroeconomic datasets on credit markets and natural resource endowments"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty", "Macroeconomics"]}]
